text:
Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif said here on Saturday the terrorists were being defeated, and in desperation, they were carrying out isolated acts to make their presence felt.

He was referring to the January 2 attack on the Pathankot airbase.

“It is our responsibility to uncover if our soil was used for the attack. We will do this and the ongoing investigations will soon be completed.”

Mr. Sharif had formed a six-member committee, headed by Additional Inspector General of Punjab’s Counter Terrorism Department, to investigate the attack in which seven security personnel were killed.

Six terrorists, allegedly from the now-outlawed Jaish-e-Mohammad group, stormed the Indian Air Force base in Punjab’s Pathankot town and killed seven security personnel. They, too, were killed by the Indian security forces.

Punjab Law Minister Rana Sanaullah said none of the ‘suspects’ arrested in connection with the attack had been charged. “The investigation team is probing the matter and its findings will be made public,” he told reporters. — PTI
title: Terrorists are being defeated: Sharif
